item.title: ST. ELIAS MINES LTD. and INTIGOLD MINES LTD: Update on Status of Cueva Blanca Property, Peru
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Symbol:  SLI (TSX Venture Exchange)

EKL (Frankfurt Exchange)

SELSF (U.S. Clearing Symbol)

Symbol:  IGD (TSX Venture Exchange)

IDMNF (U.S. OTCQX)

February 13, 2013

NEWS RELEASE

ST. ELIAS MINES LTD. and INTIGOLD MINES LTD.

Update on Status of Cueva Blanca Property, Peru

 Vancouver, B.C. February 13, 2013 St. Elias Mines Ltd. (“St. Elias”) and Intigold Mines Ltd. (“Intigold”) are providing the following update with respect to the Cueva Blanca gold property located in northwest Peru (the “Property”).  St. Elias and Intigold entered into an Option Agreement dated June 1, 2011 and amended August 15, 2012 (the “Agreement”).  Under the terms of the Agreement, Intigold had an option to acquire a 60% interest in the Property from St. Elias.  Intigold has delivered notice to St. Elias that it is no longer going to continue with its option to earn a 60% interest in the Property. While both companies strongly believe there is great mineral potential at Cueva Blanca, the decision to drop the option is a direct result of the local communities, within the project, expressing strong concerns about, and objections to, mineral exploration activities at Cueva Blanca.  As well as general difficulties and social unrest/violence being encountered in northern Peru by other exploration companies such as Candente Coppersat’s Canariaco Project, which adjoins the Cueva Blanca to the east and at Golden Alliance’s Rio Tabaconas Project. Cueva Blanca Property The Property covers approximately 5,800 hectares (58 square kilometres) and is located in the Lambayeque department in northwestern Peru, within the northern Peru Miocene metallogenic belt.  This belt is defined by a large number of world-class gold and copper-gold deposits of similar age (five million to 25 million years) including Yanacocha, Lagunas Norte and Pierina. Also of great importance are world-class copper-gold porphyry deposits, such as Rio Blanco, Canariaco, La Granja, Cerro Corona, Minas Conga-Galeno-Michiqillay, Magistral and Antamina. The giant gold deposits and the Cu-Au porphyries often occur in clusters (for example, Yanacocha-Conga-Galeno-Michiqillay). Discrete vein- and breccia-hosted deposits of gold and polymetallic mineralization occur adjacent to some copper porphyry deposits. The Property is bordered to the south and southeast by mineral concessions of Vale SA, and Barrick Gold holds extensive mineral concessions four kilometres to the north. The Property lies within the northern member of a pair of profound east-west tectonic warps that cross northern Peru. These flexures are marked by an abrupt change in the direction of the regional geological trend from northwest to east-west. Within the southernmost of these tectonic features are the multimillion-ounce Yanacocha gold mine and numerous Cu-Au porphyry deposits. Both the northern and southern structures are on the order of 60 to 80 kilometres wide; they extend right across the Andes from the Pacific Ocean to the Amazon River basin. The locations of the giant Yanacocha gold mine and other gold deposits and Cu-Au porphyries of the Cajamarca district may be controlled or at least influenced by east to northeast structures within the large-scale southern tectonic flexure.  The Cueva Blanca Property, as well as the Canariaco and Rio Blanco Cu-Au porphyries and gold prospects such as Las Huaquillas (Inca One) and Rio Tabaconas (Golden Alliance) appear to be within the northern tectonic flexure. An important feature of the Property is the Cruz gold/silver epithermal vein system.  Some examples of exceptional classic epithermal deposits with geologic characteristics broadly similar to the Cruz vein system are Kupol (Russia), El Penon (Chile), and Tayoltita, Guanajuato and Pachuca (Mexico). Exploration History Exploration at Cueva Blanca followed a classic pattern:  acquisition based on geologic reasoning, property-wide prospecting and subsequent discovery of precious metal showings, detailed surface exploration of these showings and other mineralized zones followed by an initial exploratory diamond drilling program.  The historic drill assays and the analytical results from the surface geochemical samples provide an indication of the gold-silver potential of the property and warrant continuing exploration. The previously announced exploration and confirmation work program that was conducted in 2011 consisted of sampling of outcrops and trenches at the Cruz Vein System.  Fire assays of irregularly spaced samples along a strike length of 850 metres returned a length-weighted average grade of 2.84 grams per tonne (g/t) gold across an average width of 4.3 metres.  These results are not representative of the true grade, width or length of the vein system, because the sample locations were restricted to natural outcrops and trenches excavated in areas of shallow overburden, at arbitrary points along an 850-metre strike interval of the vein system.  However, the results are consistent with sample results from earlier programs in the same area, and at the least they provide an incomplete and preliminary indication of the dimensions and grades of the exposed sections of the vein system. Historic exploration work on the Cruz Vein System included 91 trenches and 18 drill holes totalling 1,860 metres.  The drilling tested a 300-metre segment of the vein system, named “Zone 1”.  This work established that the Cruz quartz veins have consistently anomalous gold and silver grades, and that the vein system appears to be a classic epithermal gold-silver deposit. The  highlights of the 1997 Cruz Vein drill program include core intervals (not true widths) of six metres of 2.31 grams per tonne (“g/t Au”) in DDH CB-01, six metres of 2.96 g/t Au in DDH CB-03 (including 1.75 metres of 7.45 g/t Au), 1.5 metres of 22.68 g/t Au in DDH CB-5, 9.5 metres of 8.09 g/t Au in CB-17 (including 1.5 metres of 35.84 g/t Au), and 10.8 metres of 2.41 g/t Au and 1.2 metres of 6.95 g/t Au in DDH CB-22.  Every one of the twenty-two historic diamond drill holes intersected the Cruz vein system, but three of the 22 holes, which were adjacent step-out holes (DDH CB-8, CB-10 and CB-12) within a 100-metre long segment of the vein system, intersected sheeted veins with higher than normal calcite content.  These calcite-dominant veins reported lower-than average gold grades.  Gold assays from the other nineteen higher-grade drill holes ranged from 0.9 g/t Au to 35.84 g/t over core lengths of 0.95 metres to 10.8 metres. The quartz-carbonate Cruz veins contain virtually no sulphides; the veins outcrop strongly along strike in three main multi-vein sheeted zones (Zones 1, 2 and 3).  All of these sheeted vein zones are exposed on low ridges along the trace of the vein system, and each exposure is approximately 300 metres long.  The sheeted veins can be traced from outcrop to outcrop through the intervening stream gullies but they are poorly exposed in the low ground.  The vein system as a whole outcrops sporadically along strike to the southeast and northwest of the drilled area for a distance of approximately three kilometres.  The historic exploratory drilling only tested a 300-m segment of the vein system (Zone 1) to true depths of 40 metres to 100 metres, and only five of the 22 holes were drilled as deep as 100 metres (true depth, not hole length).  All five of these deeper holes intersected the Cruz vein system. While the companies have no reason to doubt the accuracy of the historic results, the existing data should not be relied upon until the Companies' own exploration work confirms that the data meet National Instrument 43-101 standards for disclosure.  Historic results and the work that generated them predate the enactment of National Instrument 43-101, and may not meet the requirements of that policy. For additional information on St. Elias and its projects, please visit us at www.steliasmines.com or call Danny Aaron at 1-888-895-5522 (toll free US and Canada).  For additional information about Intigold Mines Ltd. and its projects, please visit us at www.intigold.com or call Lori McClenahan, President at 604-669-4677. ST. ELIAS MINES LTD. & INTIGOLD MINES LTD. (Signed “Lori McClenahan”) Lori McClenahan, President Neither the TSX Venture Exchange nor its Regulation Services Provider (as that term is defined in policies of the TSX Venture Exchange) accepts responsibility for the adequacy or accuracy of this release.  This News Release may contain forward-looking statements including, but not limited to, comments regarding the timing and content of upcoming work programs, geological interpretations, potential mineral recovery processes, etc. Forward-looking statements address future events and conditions and therefore involve inherent risks and uncertainties. Actual results may differ materially from those currently anticipated in such statement

item.title: Intigold Mines Ltd. Receives Update From TTAGIT
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Symbol:  IGD - TSX.V

OTCQX

February 14, 2013

NEWS RELEASE

Intigold Mines Ltd. Receives Update From TTAGIT

 Vancouver, BC, February 14, 2013, Lori McClenahan, President of Intigold Mines Ltd. (the “Company”), announces today that the Company has received the following update from TTAGIT Social Networks Inc. (“TTAGIT”).  The Company owns a 51% interest in TTAGIT.

“TTAGIT Works on Architecture of the Site and Plans the iPhone Build TTAGIT has been working on the Architecture of both the front end and the back end of the website as well as planning a build for the iphone. To allow for a faster mobile application TTAGIT needs to do some clean up to the architecture on the back end. At the same time some clean up on the front end is necessary to stay on top of current technologies. To achieve this we are implementing Redis on the back end, which is an open source, advanced key-value store and working with Node.js a platform built on Chrome's JavaScript runtime for easily building fast, scalable network applications to build in real time. Node.js uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient, perfect for data-intensive real-time applications that run across distributed devices. On the front end we will be using Twitter’s Bootstrap Framework to clean things up and allow for easier scaling with HTML5, CSS and Javascript. Bootstrap is a front-end toolkit for rapidly developing web applications. It is a collection of CSS and HTML conventions. It uses some of the latest browser techniques to provide you with stylish typography, forms, buttons, tables, grids, navigation. Some of the changes TTAGIT will be making will be combining the username and full name into one user name which allows for spaces and multiples of the same name. This is where Redis comes in, by using unique ID’s will allow us to separate usernames from the actual user and store multiples of the same user name without having to block users from using their own names as user names because it is already taken. This allows the system to have several ‘John Doe’s’ without affecting the database. We are also introducing the ability to re-post and to share posts via Twitter, Facebook and Google+. Also we are implementing some context into posts that have been made by our extensions over URL’s by scraping the original article through RSS feeds and posting them back with the original comment a user clicks on. The biggest thing that we are working towards is being responsive and asynchronous. This means that the application will view the same on multiple screen sizes and devices. Also uploaded will happen in real time asynchronous by allowing the back end to work while the front end delivers the post. We are working toward more mobility by introducing our iphone application with all the new features and catching our Android application up to speed. Some more applications for mobile are in the works that run on the TTAGIT engine, stay tuned for more news to come.”  For information on Intigold and its projects, please visit us at www.intigold.com or call Lori McClenahan, President at 604-669-4677 or toll free at 1-888-895-5522: INTIGOLD MINES LTD. (signed “Lori McClenahan”)  Lori McClenahan, President  Neither the TSX Venture Exchange nor its Regulation Services Provider (as that term is defined in policies of the TSX Venture Exchange) accepts responsibility for the adequacy or accuracy of this release.

 NEWS RELEASE

Intigold Mines Ltd. Receives Update From TTAGIT

Vancouver, BC, February 28, 2013, Lori McClenahan, President of Intigold Mines Ltd. (the “Company”), announces today that the Company has received the following update from TTAGIT Social Networks Inc. (“TTAGIT”).  The Company owns a 51% interest in TTAGIT.  “TTAGIT Social Networks Inc. Taps Global Branding/Marketing Firm, Tenner And Associates, Inc to Roll Out Social Media Promotions.  Las Vegas, NV -  TTAGIT, an Open Forum Discussion Social Network and Comment Management System, is poised for significant growth.  To assure that its highly original content, which will include contests and promotions for its users, gains maximum visibility and traction, TTAGIT has hired Lisa Tenner and her experienced, “out of the box thinking” team to position its brand and products in powerful ways.   From high school students to senior citizens, anyone who wants to comment unmoderated over any URL (by computer or mobile platform), will be able to do so with TTAGITs proven technology.  Tenner has previously worked with TTAGIT in securing Jeremy Ausmus, a Final Table star at last year’s World Series of Poker, for its poker Hub.  Jeremy’s star power significantly elevated the Hub’s cachet and popularity.  Tenner is known for engaging online audiences to move forward with technology that can enhance their online experiences and communications.  Tenner, called a visionary by her peers, considers the TTAGIT model the most sophisticated and in-demand platform moving forward in communications that builds communities.  "I am thrilled to be a part of this team”, remarked Tenner "and look forward to introducing TTAGIT’s future programs to an increasingly wider audience."  Founded in April 2012, TTAGIT SOCIAL NETWORKS INC is a Vancouver, British Columbia company that provides an Open Forum Discussion Social Network and Comment Management System to users on the Internet who wish to comment over any URL with one log in system. TTAGIT is 51% owned by Intigold Mines Ltd which is publicly traded on the TSX.V (IGD.V) and the OTCQX (IDMF). For more information on TTAGIT SOCIAL NETWORKS INC, please call (604) 649-6394 or visit https://www.ttagit.com  About Tenner and Associates, Inc. Tenner and Associates specializes in BAM!-- “Branding and Marketing—with Impact!” The company creates “BUZZ” and “BUSINESS” through signature events, entertainment and hands-on consumer interactive sponsorship programs designed to sell or build affinity.  Tenner and Associates has successfully married the worlds of music, entertainment, sports, pop culture, media and tourism for her clients, which include the Las Vegas Cosmopolitan Resort and Casino, Hard Rock Hotel and Casino, Paris Hotel and Casino, Jeep, VH1, The PartyPoker Million, Elle Magazine and Card Player Cruises Tenner is also the co founder of www.pokergives.org.  For more information on Tenner and Associates, go to www.tennerandassoc.com or call (702) 496 3286.”  For information on Intigold and its projects, please visit us at www.intigold.com or call Lori McClenahan, President at 604-669-4677 or toll free at 1-888-895-5522: INTIGOLD MINES LTD. (signed “Lori McClenahan”)  Lori McClenahan, President  Neither the TSX Venture Exchange nor its Regulation Services Provider (as that term is defined in policies of the TSX Venture Exchange) accepts responsibility for the adequacy or accuracy of this release.

item.title: Intigold Mines Ltd. Closes Partial Private Placement / Hires IR Consultant
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Trading Symbol: IGD (TSX Venture Exchange) IDMNF (U.S. OTCQX)

April 24, 2013

NEWS RELEASE

Intigold Mines Ltd. Closes Partial Private Placement / Hires IR Consultant

Vancouver, BC, April 24, 2013, Intigold Mines Ltd. (IGD – TSX.V and IDMNF – OTC QX) today announces the following: Private Placement Intigold has closed $200,000 of the non-brokered private placement (the “Private Placement”) as announced on January 31, 2013 and April 15, 2013.  The Company has issued 1,818,181 units at a price of $0.11 per unit for total proceeds of $200,000.  Each unit consists of one common share of the Company and one non-transferable share purchase warrant.  Each warrant entitles the holder thereof to purchase one additional common share of the Company for a period of two years following closing at a price of $0.15 per share.  All securities issued in connection with this private placement are subject to a four-month hold period.  The proceeds will be used for general working capital. The Company also announces that, due to recent developments with respect to its investment in TTAGIT Social Networks Inc., it has cancelled the remainder of the Private Placement. Investor Relations Intigold has entered into a consultant agreement with Mr. Jeff Ruskowsky to provide investor relations, corporate marketing, communication enhancement and strategic awareness services.  The services provided by Mr. Ruskowsky encompass building and maintaining an investor audience for the Company for distribution of press releases and development-focused updates, increasing awareness about the Company through access to established relationships with existing and potential investors. In consideration of his services, the Company has agreed to pay Mr. Ruskowsky a fee of $2,500 per month for an initial term of three months commencing April 22, 2013, after which the agreement continues on a month-to-month basis, subject to the Company's right to terminate upon one month’s notice.  Mr. Ruskowsky will also be entitled to receive incentive stock options to purchase common shares in the capital of the Company, from time to time, at the discretion of the Board of Directors at such price or prices and upon such terms as may be acceptable to the TSX Venture Exchange.  Mr.Ruskowsky indirectly owns warrants to purchase 455,000 common shares of the Company at a price of $0.22 per share. For information on Intigold and its projects, please visit us at www.intigold.com or call  604-669-4677 or toll free at 1-888-895-5522: INTIGOLD MINES LTD. (signed “Lori McClenahan”) Lori McClenahan, President Neither the TSX Venture Exchange nor its Regulation Services Provider (as that term is defined in policies of the TSX Venture Exchange) accepts responsibility for the adequacy or accuracy of this release.

item.title: Intigold Mines Ltd. - TTAGIT Update
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Trading Symbol: IGD (TSX Venture Exchange) IDMNF (U.S. OTCQX)

July 30, 2013

NEWS RELEASE

Intigold Mines Ltd. - TTAGIT Update

Vancouver, BC, July 30, 2013, Intigold Mines Ltd. (IGD - TSX.V and IDMNF - OTC QX) has received the following update from TTAGIT Social Networks Inc. ("TTAGIT"). Intigold owns a 51% interest in TTAGIT. "TTAGIT's Next Step – Monetization TTAGIT's planned next step is to monetize its competitive advantage of providing the ability to comment over any URL or website using live feed. TTAGIT intends to monetize this advantage utilizing strategic alliances with existing businesses on the internet. For example:
  •  with online shopping networks where buyers would have the ability to shop and make a decision while reading comments from previous purchasers of a product; and
  •  with online trading companies where clients would have the ability to trade online while reading the latest internet news and relevant topics.
TTAGIT Developing Phatpen TTAGIT is presently developing "Phatpen", an application being built over top of the TTAGIT engine which will allow users to make stock trades right over top of a web page with a browser extension or smartphone. Our goal with Phatpen is to enable users to connect to their trading accounts to make web surfing and trading seamless. Once completed, Phatpen will also let you automate trades, allowing you to set prices and amounts to automatically buy or sell at the given prices you want. A live feed will keep you updated on the markets you want to watch, never missing a news release. Using the TTAGIT engine, users will be able to engage in discussions about markets on the bullboards right over top of any webpage. Phatpen will be used on Google Chrome, Firefox, IOS or Android." item.title: Intigold Mines Ltd. - TTAGIT Update
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Trading Symbol: IGD (TSX Venture Exchange) IDMNF (U.S. OTCQX)

Sept 10, 2013

NEWS RELEASE

Intigold Mines Ltd. - TTAGIT Update

Vancouver, BC, September 10, 2013, Intigold Mines Ltd. (IGD - TSX.V and IDMNF - OTC QX) has received the following update from TTAGIT Social Networks Inc. ("TTAGIT"). Intigold owns a 51% interest in TTAGIT. "TTAGIT is architecting an API which will complement its patent-pending revolutionary technology which will work in pulling all tweets from any URL whether they be shortened or not. This will allow users to see all tweets connected with a URL (web page). When a user opens the TTAGIT extension over a web page, if there has been any tweets of that URL, it will show in the feed. This will add content to TTAGIT's streams and show what people are talking about on URL's from Twitter thus helping to populate TTAGIT. This move is a start to bringing social networks into TTAGIT's architecture in order to interact with content relevant to a URL (web page). Users would then be able to respond back which would also tweet the response as an @Reply on Twitter. TTAGIT is also working on utilizing Twitter's card option which let's users attach a video, photo, gallery or a product description to a tweet. TTAGIT is also working on architecture that will allow users to interact more with Twitter from within TTAGIT, like the use of #Hashtags and @Replies within TTAGIT. "The company is very pleased with the current progression of TTAGIT and the upcoming development of Phat Pen (TTAGIT's Financial Application) and looks forward to implementing these changes to increase content over URL's using TTAGIT's engine" stated Leigh Akin , Creative Director of TTAGIT." Developed and owned 51% by Intigold Mines Ltd., TTAGIT is a revolutionary online tool that lets you comment on everything on the internet from your browser without having to login to several accounts or register with a number of other websites. Designed to "tag" the moment, TTAGIT is the new face of commenting and social networking. TTAGIT, the first open-forum discussion social network and comment management system that permits users to comment on all URLs with one login and allows you to talk over any website without leaving the page. TTAGIT is a commenting and social networking tool where members can engage in conversations and participate in debates on sites and portals that currently do not allow live streaming. For more information please visit: http://ttagit.com/ For information on Intigold and its projects, please visit us at www.intigold.com or call 604-669-4677 or toll free at 1-888-895-5522. INTIGOLD MINES LTD. (signed "Lori McClenahan") Lori McClenahan, President Neither the TSX Venture Exchange nor its Regulation Services Provider (as that term is defined in policies of the TSX Venture Exchange) accepts responsibility for the adequacy or accuracy of this release. item.title: Intigold Mines Ltd. - TTAGIT Update
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Trading  Symbol: IGD (TSX Venture Exchange) IDMNF (U.S. OTCQX) Feb 18, 2014

NEWS RELEASE

Intigold Mines Ltd. - TTAGIT Update

Vancouver, BC, February 17, 2014, Intigold Mines Ltd. (IGD - TSX.V) has received the following update from TTAGIT Social Networks Inc. ("TTAGIT"). Intigold owns a 51% interest in TTAGIT. "TTAGIT Update TTAGIT has been working on the new release of TTAGIT production. We have moved our test server from a dedicated server to the cloud for consistency between our cloud server and test server. We intend on adding Twitter to our commenting system and replacing the social network with Twitters for more content on URL's. TTAGIT has gone with a more modern way of handling real time and we are using faster frameworks to take out any lag in time. TTAGIT also has made our new system more portable to other platforms by using cross platform frameworks in building, which saves on time and allows for a more fluid approach with multi-platforms. In addition, we realize that we are able to monetize and build out TTAGIT by adding several applications to increase users by picking out markets independently. These will include Phatpen, which is a financial application that allows users to make stock trades from their browser extensions using TTAGIT as a bullboard. At TTAGIT we have also architected a peer 2-peer ticket sales application that works for mobile phones. Allowing users to buy and sell tickets for events they want to host, this is usable for events like music, plays, food shows or anything you can imagine really. We are also working on a mason style poster wall where event creators can post event posters. The application is called de2our. As well as a peer 2 peer ticket sales we have also architected a chat room service using TTAGIT's engine for group chatting, sort of like a flirt applications where users can talk in private rooms, the application is called TEZE. All applications are built on the TTAGIT framework. We shall be announcing the New TTAGIT shortly and emailing everyone who has already signed up to TTAGIT to notify them of the changes in the new system. " For information on Intigold and its projects, please visit us at www.intigold.com or call 604-669-4677 or toll free at 1-888-895-5522. INTIGOLD MINES LTD. (signed "Lori McClenahan") Lori McClenahan, President Neither the TSX Venture Exchange nor its Regulation Services Provider (as that term is defined in policies of the TSX Venture Exchange) accepts responsibility for the adequacy or accuracy of this release.

item.title: Intigold Mines Ltd - TTAGIT Update
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Trading  Symbol: IGD (TSX Venture Exchange) IDMNF (U.S. OTCQX) March 17, 2014

NEWS RELEASE

Intigold Mines Ltd. - TTAGIT Update

Vancouver, BC, / ACCESSWIRE / March 17, 2014 / Intigold Mines Ltd. (IGD - TSX-V) has received the following update from TTAGIT Social Networks Inc. ("TTAGIT"). Intigold owns a 51% interest in TTAGIT.

"TTAGIT Update - de2our

TTAGIT has worked out the business model for its peer-to-peer ticket sales application, "de2our". De2our is a mobile application which allows peer-to-peer ticket sales for any event, large or small. The focus is on making selling tickets as easy as possible.

De2our is not focused on any one genre of event. It can be used for any event imaginable that requires tickets (for example, bands, art shows, sporting events, bake sales, fundraisers, parties, workshops, competitions, etc.) Using de2our, event coordinators will be able to: -select from a variety of venues in any area and book the venue;

-set the number of tickets and prices of tickets for their event;

-upload tickets and sell through a mobile application;

-provide free tickets to promoters;

-create their own "poster wall" for marketing (post an event poster and description, post photos, videos (youtube, vimeo), music (soundcloud, pandora), comment (ttagit comment system);

-verify the tickets sold with the QR reader built into the application which can scan either the QR code from the users phone or a printed email;

-use a bar code gun for scanning, which is suggested for larger events.

In addition, event coordinators can compare event sales that they have against one another and see a tally of all events that they have posted on de2our. Multiple administrators can be added to the event with an ability to promo tickets from the application if designated.

For the de2our user, they will be taken through an activity feed builder upon sign up that will customize their activity feeds by choices of categories and locations of events. Users can buy tickets directly from the activity feeds and or they have a choice of using the poster wall. Users can comment on events before, during and after with the TTAGIT commenting system."

For information on Intigold and its projects, please visit us at www.intigold.com or call 604-669-4677 or toll free at 1-888-895-5522.

INTIGOLD MINES LTD.

(signed "Lori McClenahan") Lori McClenahan, President

item.title: Intigold Mines Ltd. - TTAGIT Update
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Trading  Symbol: IGD (TSX Venture Exchange) April 2, 2014

NEWS RELEASE

VANCOUVER, BC / ACCESSWIRE / April 2, 2014 / Intigold Mines Ltd. (IGD - TSX-V) has received the following update from TTAGIT Social Networks Inc. ("TTAGIT"). Intigold owns a 51% interest in TTAGIT. TTAGIT - de2our - Update on Business Plan TTAGIT has further advanced its business plan for de2our. De2our is a mobile application which allows peer-to-peer ticket sales for any event, large or small. The focus is on making selling tickets as easy as possible. De2our plans to do with ticket sales what Groupon has done for coupons, that is, to allow the common user to create and sell tickets for events with simplicity and low cost. De2our will make peer-to-peer ticket sales easy and will use a smart activity stream that is customized to the user to bring events that are relative to every user's experience. The main focus is on the ability to scale from smaller events to very large events. We accommodate this by allowing ticket sales directly from the mobile device and allow bar codes for scanning much larger events from a scanning gun. De2our will take a percentage of the ticket sales, and will hold funds sold until an expired date where ticket sales stop. Once revenue is proven, then marketing becomes much simpler as raising more money for marketing increases the sales that are generated. The room for growth in on-line ticket sales is growing by the day. De2our will also be a mobile application that will showcase TTAGIT's new commenting system which is made to be built into other products as a commenting tool using Twitter as a social network and a way to categorize topics. Our main focus is to increase revenue with an application that not only generates income but also can scale limitlessly. We think de2our is our best bet for revenue building and, amongst many other ideas, have chosen to go this route due to its ability to showcase TTAGIT but also to gain widespread interest as it has already generated interest amongst many people within the market. We look forward to bringing you more and are ready to produce some splash pages shortly where you can register to be on our mailing list for launch dates." For information on Intigold and its projects, please visit us at www.intigold.com or call 604-669-4677 or toll free at 1-888-895-5522. INTIGOLD MINES LTD. (signed "Lori McClenahan") Lori McClenahan, President Neither the TSX Venture Exchange nor its Regulation Services Provider (as that term is defined in policies of the TSX Venture Exchange) accepts responsibility for the adequacy or accuracy of this release.

item.title: Intigold Mines Ltd. – TTAGIT Update – Marketing Advisory Committee
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Trading  Symbol: IGD (TSX Venture Exchange) April 16, 2014

NEWS RELEASE

VANCOUVER, BC / April 16, 2014 / Intigold Mines Ltd. (IGD - TSX-V) has received the following update from TTAGIT Social Networks Inc. ("TTAGIT"). Intigold owns a 51% interest in TTAGIT.

TTAGIT Forms Marketing Advisory Committee TTAGIT has formed a Marketing Advisory Committee ("MAC") consisting of Lisa Tenner and Eddie Wenrick. The MAC is charged with branding TTAGIT and de2our, identifying corporate opportunities and determining innovative and effective marketing to increase the visibility and awareness of TTAGIT and de2our. Lisa Tenner, President and founder of Tenner and Associates, Inc., is considered a visionary among her peers and industry leaders. Tenner and Associates, Inc. is a Las Vegas-based company focused on branding and marketing in the corporate world as well as event productions and sponsorships in the entertainment, sports, convention and other industries. Ms. Tenner is on the advisory board of the American Gaming Association. Additionally Ms. Tenner was named "Event Producer of the Year" for her work in live performance production and representation of artists and celebrities. Eddie Wenrick's career in music and entertainment has encompassed the roles of record label executive, artist manager, concert promoter, music magazine publisher, executive producer, and radio broadcasting executive. He has spent the last 40 plus years traversing virtually every medium, including music, print and digital media, film, television and sports. For information on Intigold and its projects, please visit us at www.intigold.com or call 604-669-4677 or toll free at 1-888-895-5522. INTIGOLD MINES LTD. item.title: Intigold Mines Ltd. - TTAGIT Update - Splash Page for Phatpen
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Trading  Symbol: IGD (TSX Venture Exchange) May 7, 2014

NEWS RELEASE

Vancouver, BC,  May 7, 2014,  Intigold Mines Ltd. (IGD - TSX-V) has received the following update from TTAGIT Social Networks Inc. ("TTAGIT"). Intigold owns a 51% interest in TTAGIT. TTAGIT - Splash Page for Phatpen TTAGIT has put up a Splash Page for its Phatpen financial commenting and trading extension at phatpen.com. You can sign up for our mailing list to keep up with any developments from the subscribe button at the top of the website. Phatpen is an application in development that is built over top of the TTAGIT engine that allows users to make stock trades right over top of a web page with a browser extension or smartphone. With Phatpen you will be able to connect to your Etrade account to make web surfing and trading seamless. Using the TTAGIT engine, users can engage in discussions about markets on the Bullboards right over top of any webpage. Phatpen will be able to scrape relevant stock symbols to any article you are reading and serves them up for you to look at the financial information such as latest news releases, recent discussions and the stock ticker. Phatpen will use the social network of Twitter so you can share any of your progress on Phatpen to Twitter or follow users that you follow on Twitter on Phatpen if they have a Phatpen account. You can also see what people have been tweeting about the market by looking over the feed for any market as tweets are included. Phatpen also takes advantage of Twitter's Cashtag ( $ ) that shows stock symbols and tweets relative to them. Phatpen will be used on Google Chrome, Firefox, IOS or Android. Phatpen makes trading seamless with Internet surfing. Never let a good opportunity go by because you weren't ready again. For information on Intigold and its projects, please visit us at www.intigold.com or call 604-669-4677 or toll free at 1-888-895-5522. INTIGOLD MINES LTD.
